name: Cannon Mountain

trails_config.name: Hi-Cannon & Lonesome Lake Loop
trails_config.description: A scenic loop starting at Lafayette Campground: ascend via the Hi-Cannon Trail, which features a wooden ladder climb and views of Franconia Ridge, to reach Cannon’s summit tower. Descend by the Kinsman Ridge Trail past the famous cliffs, then down to Lonesome Lake, where the AMC hut and tranquil waters offer a perfect rest stop. The loop finishes on the Lonesome Lake Trail. This loop is steep in parts, but the variety of features — from ladder scrambles to lake views — makes it memorable.
trails_config.parking_info: Lafayette Place Campground, I-93 Franconia Notch

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 4100 feet, Cannon Mountain offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4100 feet, Cannon Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Hi-Cannon & Lonesome Lake Loop**, a **5.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **The Basin (Franconia Notch)**, which is just 0.9 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.

logistics.parking_info: Lafayette Place Campground, I-93 Franconia Notch
